item_name: Robbie Basho - Visions of the Country (1978)
notes: 2025-01-06. 12-string fingerpicking & piano w intensity, vulnerability. Vibrato-rich mystical vocal. Hypnotic, shimmering [1978, Windham Hill Records]
Rock, avant-garde musician, producer, Chicago, active 1989-
2025-01-08 (re-listening). Just stunning & first track goes so hard. Glenn Kotche drums. Lyrics occasionally spiritually damaging [2001, Drag City]
connection_labels: released on Domino (Jim in UK; JB in US)

item_name: Robbie Basho - The Falconer's Arm I (1967)
notes: 2025-01-20. Vast, expressive 12-string & on one track, flute. Often trancelike, evokes Hindustani classical music. Spiritually elevated [1967, Takoma Records]
2025-01-06. Incredibly mellow. Nice synth key, horn timbres. Night Walk like Blue Nile meets Earthbound OST [2022, City Slang]
2025-01-08. Cool busy programmed drum grooves. Soft vocal. Subtle, relaxed, comfortable [2004, Domino]

item_name: Horse Jumper of Love - Disaster Trick (2024)
notes: 2025-01-08. Great fuzzy guitar melodies, yearning chord changes. Lyrics sometimes juvenile but in a good way. Recorded in Asheville; Karly & MJ of Wednesday guest [2024, Run for Cover]

notes: 2025-01-09 (re-listening). On some days my favourite album ever. 19 songs all so good. I'D LIKE TO THANK YOU ALL FOR NOTHING [1996, Reprise (Warner Music)]
2025-01-09. Clean, spacious Nashville production & excellent musicianship. Lots of different styles. Fun [2024, Rounder]

item_name: Wilburn Burchette - Opens the Seven Gates of Transcendental Consciousness (1972)
notes: 2025-01-12. Passionate, lyrical solo guitar often around drone w plenty echo. Homemade guitar (!) & electronics [1972, Ebos; 2024, Numero Group]
2025-01-17. V clean, spacious, texturally engaging. Elegant production & orchestration. Almost Joni-like vocal. Approachable [2025, Fat Possum]

notes: 2025-02-01. Adventurous techno/Bjork-like pop. Lots of cool twists & turns. Like a less humourous Pop 2 [2025, Young]

item_name: Bonnie Prince Billy - The Purple Bird (2025)
notes: 2025-02-20. More country than other BPB I've heard (nice). Good mix of sincerity and humour, light and dark. Wish he didn't sing about skinny dipping etc. [2025, No Quarter]
